title: Hutton in the Forest Walks

images.title: Derek Voller / Hutton in the Forest House
images.caption: Hutton in the Forest House

images.title: Rose and Trev Clough / Cascade, Hutton-in-the-Forest
images.caption: Cascade. Made in the 1730s. The grounds here are full of colourful wild flowers.

images.title: Rose and Trev Clough / Lake at Hutton-in-the-Forest
images.caption: The lake, or Middle Pond, was created in the 18th century, and was stocked with fish for the table.

images.caption: Sheep-grazed parkland across the road from the house, the seat of Lord Inglewood.

description: This walk visits the Grade I listed Hutton in the Forest near Penrith in Cumbria. The grounds of this fine country house are a a lovely place for a walk with woodland, parkland, a pretty lake and 17th Century landscaped gardens to explore. Look out for several historic buildings in the grounds including a 17th century dovecote and the 13th century church of St James. The gardens are also delightful with herbaceous plants, ponds with cascades and some fine topiary. The woodland walk will take you to rhododendrons and magnificent American conifers, planted as a small arboretum in the 1860s. Look out for a variety of wildlife including red squirrel, roe deer and many species of bird on the trail.
